lexUnit.name: despondent.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: in low spirits from loss of hope or courage.

sentence.text: She knew that his Gothic romance and glossary were being turned down by publisher after publisher and he grew despondent as he rewrote and rewrote again .
Diana took the criticism to heart , avidly read what was being said about her and became depressed and despondent .
She was becoming increasingly despondent about the way things were going .
The mood was despairing , despondent , and war-weary -- apathetic rather than rebellious .
And our hero in his turn , felt despondent and fearful , for his little grey mentor had given him no instructions for this eventuality .
It was a pretty despondent group that sat around the fire of the LRDG patrol , each sunk in his own thoughts .
At first Tony looked less happy than before , and said he had become somewhat despondent about his lack of progress in finding employment .
We are more despondent and needy than ever !
` Ma , " he said in a tentative tone of voice , his face going slowly pink with the strain of trying to communicate with his despondent parent .
Nigel became despondent but I did n't .
Both Mr Pitman Senior and Junior were reps who grew progressively despondent over the standard of rooms and services they encountered on their travels .
Protagonists of unity may have been despondent about the loss of the EDC and the European Political Community , but were not routed .
“ I 'll have the use of a locker at the airport … ” she trailed off with a despondent sigh .
By six o'clock the water had n't arrived and Haverford , looking at their despondent faces , said , ` It 's like a death in the family . "
He felt increasingly irritated and despondent .
He was beginning to feel a bit despondent about the kind of questions Jean was asking .
By comparison , she felt drained and despondent .
Inevitably some become despondent , fearing they will never work again .
Privately , Juliet was feeling rather despondent .
Squeezed like despondent sardines , they looked as if they were huddling for warmth .
` Do n't be despondent , " she told me .
A despondent Renault worker remarked , ` It seems to me that we came very close to something new . "
Following yesterday 's revival in fortunes , the London share market was in a despondent mood as the Treasury deflated hopes of early interest rate cuts .
Yeah , but she 's a bit despondent now is n't she , really ?
